benchmark_details.name: Leveraging LLM Embeddings for Cross Dataset Label Alignment and Zero Shot Music Emotion Prediction
benchmark_details.overview: This work presents a novel method for music emotion recognition that leverages Large Language Model (LLM) embeddings for label alignment across multiple datasets and zero-shot prediction on novel categories. The method enables robust cross-dataset label alignment and facilitates zero-shot inference on new datasets with previously unseen emotion labels.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop more comprehensive and robust music emotion recognition models that can generalize to a wider range of emotional experiences beyond the singular datasets used during training.

data.source: The datasets used include the MTG-Jamendo Dataset, Computer Audition Lab 500 dataset, and the Emotify Dataset.
data.size: Over 55,000 music recordings, 500 songs, and 400 music excerpts
data.annotation: Annotations from multiple users, average scores used for determination of true labels.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on cosine similarity and average scores across different datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate improved generalization and performance on unseen datasets.
methodology.baseline_results: F1 scores include 0.402 for zero-shot on Emotify, 0.248 for MTG-Jamendo, and 0.262 for CAL500.
methodology.validation: Validated through extensive experiments and comparison against baseline models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data sourced from openly available datasets under Creative Commons licenses.
